perturbation.original_text:
DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited.

DIVIDEND OPTIONS. If dividends are credited after premiums can no longer be paid under this contract, dividends will be paid in cash. Otherwise, dividends will be applied under the Payment of Premium option unless the Cash option has been chosen in writing.

Cash. Dividends are paid in cash.

Payment of Premium. Dividends are applied as payment of a Net Premium.
perturbation.changed_text:
DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited.

DIVIDEND OPTIONS. Even if dividends are *not* credited after premiums can no longer be paid under this contract, dividends *may* be paid in cash, or dividends may be applied under the Payment of Premium option. The Society reserves the right to change dividend options at any time without prior notice.

Cash. Dividends are paid in cash, when applicable.

Payment of Premium. Dividends are applied as payment of a Net Premium, subject to change.
perturbation.explanation: The original text implies that dividends will be paid in cash if they are credited after premiums are no longer paid. The modified text makes the dividend payout uncertain, indicating that dividends 'may' be paid and the society can change dividend options. This contradicts the implied certainty of the original clause and introduces ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text:
ENTIRE CONTRACT

In the ENTIRE CONTRACT section, the first phrase and numbered list are amended to read:

The Entire Contract consists of: 1) This contract including any attached riders, amendments, or endorsements; 2) The Application attached to this contract; and 3) The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society and all amendments to them. Benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by any future amendments to our Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws.
perturbation.changed_text:
ENTIRE CONTRACT

In the ENTIRE CONTRACT section, the first phrase and numbered list are amended to read:

The Entire Contract consists of: 1) This contract including any attached riders, amendments, or endorsements; 2) The Application attached to this contract; and 3) The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society and all amendments to them. Benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by any future amendments to our Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws. However, the Society reserves the right to modify benefits to comply with regulatory changes and to ensure the long-term financial stability of the Society. Any such modifications will be communicated to the contract holder.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by future amendments. The modified text contradicts this by stating that the Society reserves the right to modify benefits for regulatory compliance and financial stability. This creates uncertainty about the guaranteed nature of benefits under the contract.

perturbation.original_text:
ASSIGNMENT

The ASSIGNMENT section is amended to include the following:

You may transfer ownership of this contract in accordance with our bylaws. Society membership rights and privileges cannot be transferred or assigned.
perturbation.changed_text:
ASSIGNMENT

The ASSIGNMENT section is amended to include the following:

You may transfer ownership of this contract in accordance with our bylaws; however, the Society reserves the right to deny any transfer of ownership at its sole discretion. Society membership rights and privileges cannot be transferred or assigned.
perturbation.explanation: The original text implies that ownership can be transferred as long as it is in accordance with the bylaws. The modified text contradicts this by adding that the Society can deny any transfer at its discretion. This makes the assignability of the contract uncertain despite following the bylaws.
